alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued February 28 at 7:41AM ChST until March 02 at 7:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ***Corrected Headline for High Rip Current*** ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM CHST FRIDAY ALONG EAST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM 10 AM CHST THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 9 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Marianas Coastal Waters. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory and High Rip Current Risk, from 10 AM this morning to 7 AM ChST Friday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
